column1: #Text=—Five clergymen, composing a commission appointed by the Bishop of Exeter, sat on Tuesday and Wednesday, to inquire into the following charges made against the Rev.
#Text=Simpson, incumbent of East Teignmoutb, by Mr.
#Text=Flamank, one of the churchwardenf:—First, having lights on the Communion Table when not required for the purpose of giving light.
#Text=Second, mixing water with the wine, immediately before consecrating tbe elements for celebrating tbe Holy Communion.
#Text=Third, after the prayer of consecration raising the paten with both bands above his head.
#Text=Fourth, when the alms are collected at the Communion Service placing them, not on the table, but on a stool at the side.
#Text=Fifth, omitting the word "all" from the concluding prayer, commencing " The grace of our Lord."
#Text=Deane pro and con. the Chancellor said it was the unanimous opinion of the commissioners that there were sufficient prima facie grounds for instituting further proceedings.
